title: Cybernetic Attention: All Watched over by Machines We Learned to Watch
content: Before the attention economy consumed our lives, “pursuit tests” devised by the US military coupled man to machine with the aim of assessing focus under pressure. D. Graham Burnett explores these devices for evaluating aviators, finding a pre-history of the laboratory research that has relentlessly worked to slice and dice the attentional powers of human beings.

title: Flights of Fancy: The Nine Birds of Jacques de Fornazeris (1594)
content: Etchings of birds in a somewhat theatrical style.

title: A Prophet of the Weather: Lantern Slides by Clement Lindley Wragge (ca. 1900–22)
content: Slides from twenty years of lecturing about the workings of the universe and the fate of the soul.

title: Peter Kropotkin’s Memoirs of a Revolutionist (1899)
content: The memoirs of an aristocratic man revolutionised into an anarchist communist.

title: Happy Public Domain Day 2026!
content: Each January 1st is Public Domain Day, when a new crop of works have their copyrights expire and become free to share and reuse for any purpose. Here's our highlights for 2026.

title: Top 10 Most Read Pieces from 2025
content: From sublime spheres to hungry cats, a rundown of the ten most read of what we published this year.

title: A Thousand and One Nights in Italy: The Moorish Fantasias of Cesare Mattei and Ferdinando Panciatichi
content: In mid-19th century Italy, two eccentric aristocrats set forth on parallel projects: constructing ostentatious castles in a Moorish Revival style. Iván Moure Pazos tours the psychedelic chambers of Rochetta Mattei, optimised for electrohomeopathic healing, and Castello di Sammezzano, an immersive, orientalist fever dream.

title: Nature Morte: Chaïm Soutine’s Still Lifes (ca. 1920s)
content: Still lifes by the artist who seemed to bridge expressionism with the baroque.

title: Deceit and Disrobing: The Schefer Maqāmāt (BNF Arabe 5847, ca. 1237)
content: Illustrations of Abū Zayd and his adventures in double meaning.

title: Luke Howard’s Essay on the Modification of Clouds (1865)
content: First cloud taxonomer and a poem by Goethe.

title: The Launch of Our End-of-Year Fundraiser!
content: Our End-of-Year Fundraiser is launched, and the new postcards theme will be Attention.

title: “Quaint Dessert Dishes” in American Homes and Gardens (1911)
content: Bizarre sweet treats that resemble human and animal forms.

title: Henri Rivière’s Thirty-Six Views of the Eiffel Tower (1888–1902)
content: French lithographs of the Eiffel Tower and its environs, in the style of Japanese woodblock prints.

title: Art in Art: Cabinets of Curiosity and the Rise of the Gallery Painting
content: In the 17th century, emanating from Antwerp, a new genre of artwork came on the scene: paintings of paintings, works populated by a lush array of meta-images. From its origins in picturing private curiosity cabinets to its later use in documenting increasingly public collections, Thea Applebaum Licht charts the course of this alluring aesthetic tradition.

title: Too Computerised? Too Cold?: 1999 A.D. (1967)
content: A past vision of the future. Domestic utopia? Or sanitised hell?
